intro: Didymoplexis africana, commonly known as the African flame vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in its native habitat.
